page.title: 01The Hills of Glen Rosa
page.content: This block covers the central part of Glen Rosa & the associated hills. The valley floor is very wet and boggy, and there has been a recent attempt to put in an irrigation ditch in order to drain the footpath - which runs alongside the burn. On the east side of the Glen is Goatfell-the highest point on the island at 2866 ft ; and on the west side is Beinn a Chilabhain & coire a Bhradain. Nobody lives in this area, but it is a special site of scientific interest & a national scientific area. It is a very popular area with hill walkers, and there are many footpaths throughout the area. The most popular footpath is the one to the summit of Goatfell. This area is owned by the National Trust for Scotland. It also shows extensive features of glaciation. Spectacular.
